course_title: Physical Assessment and Clinical Decision Making for Independent Practice

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced knowledge and communication skills suitable to support a structured and systematic approach to holistic clinical assessment which incorporates the patient history with the ability to collect and appraise objective and subjective data.

Demonstrate and communicate an informed and confident approach to the use of therapeutic and investigative interventions and options that are judicious, evidenced informed, client-focused, and informed and directed by clinical findings.
Analyse and interpret assessment findings to inform differential diagnoses and patient focused management which is evidence informed and person centred.

Critically analyse social determinants of health and the subsequent impact of healthcare diagnosis and associated interventions on the patient, ensuring culturally safe, inclusive, and comprehensive solutions to patient management.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to demonstrate clinical competence in their developing role as nurse practitioners. You may choose four (4) new or known patients, and demonstrate your advanced skills in physical examination to your clinical mentors in real time. These clinical episodes will take place in your clinical setting. The time and place for these must be negotiated with your clinical mentor.

The purpose of the PE assessment is to provide the candidate with an opportunity to demonstrate the development of competence/proficiency in physical examination.

  •  The Respiratory Assessment. Weight: 5% 13:00, Friday Week 5.
  • The Cardiovascular Assessment. Weight: 5% 13:00, Friday Week 5.
  • The Abdominal Assessment. Weight: 5% 13:00, Friday Week 11.
  • The Head-to-Toe Assessment. Weight: 5% 13:00, Friday Week 11.

Assessments to be assessed by nominated members of the students' clinical Support teams (CST) within the workplace.

Final submission to include a student reflection of learning needs uploaded to Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The completed form for the relevant PE is to be submitted via Blackboard under Assessment. It will not be submitted via Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
17/09/2025

The assessment will be online and open between 07.00 and 23.00.
assessments.task_description:
The aim is to allow the student to provide evidence of their understanding of normal and abnormal findings off some of the most common x-rays, investigations, and pathology results within clinical practice.

This assessment will include chest xray, abdominal xray, and common pathology related questions. 

  • Test will be open between 0700 - 2300. 
  • You will have 60 minutes to complete the questions. Once started the test has to be completed in 60 minutes (whilst the test is open until 2300, please log in to start before 2200 or you will not have enough time to complete before you are automatically logged out at 2300).
  • The test consists of 20 multiple choice questions. The 20 questions will be presented in a random order, one at a time. You will not be able to backtrack. When you have completed the test be sure that you click the submit button. 
  • If you do not finish / complete after 60 minutes the test will close down automatically.
  • Multiple trial or submissions of the test is not allowed. 

It is up to each student to arrange so that they can undertake the test on the stated day.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submissions not allowed due to the nature of this assessment item.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Viva voce - Full Episode of Care
assessments.due_date:
20/10/2025 - 31/10/2025

Assessment period: 20th-31st October

Individual student allocation of date and time to be confirmed.
assessments.task_description:
The oral presentation (Viva voce) should refer to a complex episode of care for a patient you have managed this semester. The presentation should summarise the history of presenting illness, review of systems and physical examination and justify the diagnosis/es with appropriate evidence and pathophysiology. A complete management plan should be presented with the major focus on your assessment and review of systems and physical examination.

The presentation should allow you to exhibit a comprehensive knowledge and understanding of pathology tests, diagnostic interventions and the findings found within the physical examinations. This data should be used in your diagnostic reasoning to provide up to three differential diagnoses, a final confirmed diagnosis and the development of a problem list and management plan.

Questions from the examination team will explore your knowledge in greater detail. Marks will be awarded for a professional presentation that includes appropriate references. Students should select the case carefully; this will require the presentation of a complex episode of care in order to demonstrate the required competencies.

This case cannot be one you have submitted in this or any other course within this program.

Oral Presentation to be given in own clinical environment: discuss organisation / invitations with clinical and academic mentor in sufficient time.

  • Length: 20 minute presentation, with 15 minutes question time.
  • An accompanying power-point presentation outlining the key aspects of your case is to be submitted 1 week prior to your scheduled Viva. 
  • Submission of PowerPoint via NURS7243 Blackboard page.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment requires students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
To complete:

Standard 1 Assess using diagnostic capability.

Statement 1.1 Conducts comprehensive, relevant and holistic health assessment.

Statement 1.2 Demonstrate timely and considered use of diagnostic investigations to inform clinical decision making.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed and submitted within the NP ePortfolio.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: In the case that this assessment item is not completed, this will result in an incomplete grade for the course.ﾠ
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
14/11/2025 1:00 pm

To be submitted only once 96 IPP hours for the semester are completed.
assessments.task_description:
Clinical Performance Appraisal is a summary of performance throughout your IPP.

This form should be completed and signed by a member of your CST / clinical mentor towards the end of your IPP hours for this semester - aiming around week 10-12 of the semester, to cover the majority of your IPP journey and give a good overview of your clinical ability.

The form includes a feedback section for the member of CST, and a written reflection by the student on their own activity and learning outcomes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: CST will complete CPA and provide written feedback.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: In the case that this assessment item is not completed, this will result in an incomplete grade for the course.ﾠ
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Residential School - 2 days (28th & 29th July, 2025), Mater Hospital

A 2 day joint residential (NURS7242 & NURS7243) will be held on campus at the Mater Hospital, Brisbane.

Dates, times and venue details for the residential school can be found in the NURS7243 public timetable.

Attendance at Residential School is a mandatory requirement for the MNP program.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
